result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley A Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**CORRECTED 7-27-2016:  To reflect correct amount of cfts.**
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.  Credit given below is not duplicate to credit given in 14CF1481
Consecutive to: to 14CF1481

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Completed psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  No contact with victim's person, property, residence or family.  No contact, directly or indirectly, by any commuinication device whatsoever, with Mr Petty.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

Defendant Ashley A Miller in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Ashley A Miller in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon plea to 14CF1481-pl to charge. State recommends 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES. 15CF846, pl to Cts 3, 4 & 5. Balance DRI. The State recommends on Ct 3, 10 yrs consec, 7 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, on Ct 4-6 yrs WPS bifurcated as 3yrs IC, 3 yrs ES-I/S, Ct 5-8 yrs WPS bifurcated as  5 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, consec-I/S  5 yrs consec probation on Cts 4 & 5. Defense is free to argue.

finding of guilt

The State agrees not to file any additional charges including any alleged conspiracy charges as a concession by the State

modifying bond to $25,000.00 cash

Defendant Ashley A Miller in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Ashley A Miller in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
The State has filed a motion to amend bond. The State has also filed a stipulation and order to amend bond. Defense indicates that the defendant now wishes to have a trial. Defense indicates that if defendant wishes to go to trial, he cannot represent her due to a conflict as Mr. Conner has previously represented a co-deft in another matter. The State indicates that if the defendant does not wish to accept the plea offer as stated, the State will dismiss 15CF846 and reissue

BTC: New COP to be set  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Ct 1: 961.41(1)(d)1-Manuf/Del Heroin; Ct 2: 946.49(1)(a)-Felony BJ; Ct 3: 941.30(1)-1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety; Ct 4: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ; Ct 5: 961.41(1)(d)1-Manuf/Del Heroin; Ct 6: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. Conditions:   No contact with the victim SKK & JSM (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
